critique: This document establishes a board to investigate a labor dispute between Trans World Airlines and its employees. It aims to prevent interruption of interstate commerce. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It seems to be a fairly neutral intervention to resolve a labor dispute. It does not obviously expand executive power, but uses existing authority. It does not obviously relate to federalism or social inclusion. It seems to involve moderate economic intervention to prevent disruption.
